column1: == Climate ==
Moresby has a tropical savanna climate (Köppen: Aw) with relatively constant temperatures throughout the year. Port Moresby's average yearly rainfall is just over 1
column2: 000 millimetres or 39.37 inches
column3: making it the driest place in New Guinea.

column1: The wet season starts in December and ends in May; the dry season covers the remaining six months. This is due to the south easterly trade winds running parallel to the coast
column2: and the city being surrounded by high mountains. The average high temperatures range from 28 to 32 °C (82.4 to 89.6 °F) depending on time of year
column3: while the average low temperature shows very little seasonal variation
column4: hovering around the 23 °C (73.4 °F) mark. It tends to be slightly cooler in the city during the dry season.
